SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description1Txt: KNIGHT COMMISSION ON INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS: THE GOAL OF THE KNIGHT COMMISSION ON INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS IS TO LEAD TRANSFORMATIONAL CHANGE IN COLLEGE SPORTS TO PRIORITIZE COLLEGE ATHLETES' EDUCATION, HEALTH, SAFETY AND SUCCESS. IN 2022, THE COMMISSION'S WORK INCLUDED THE FOLLOWING:-CONDUCTED TWO NATIONAL MEETINGS OF THE KNIGHT COMMISSION IN WASHINGTON, DC - PORTIONS OF WHICH INCLUDED INVITED EXPERTS AND WERE MADE ACCESSIBLE VIRTUALLY TO OBSERVERS, INCLUDING MEDIA.-HOSTED ONE NATIONAL PUBLIC FORUM AT THE NCAA CONVENTION, WHICH WAS ALSO MADE ACCESSIBLE VIRTUALLY TO PARTICIPANTS, INCLUDING MEDIA.-COMMISSIONED INDEPENDENT RESEARCH THAT REVEALED SCHOOLS WITH LARGE RACIAL GRADUATION GAPS AMONG ATHLETES ARE QUALIFYING FOR FINANCIAL INCENTIVES FOR TEAMS' ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE; DESIGNED A SOLUTION TO ADDRESS THIS RACIAL EQUITY GAP; AND WORKED TO ADVANCE THE ADOPTION OF THE PROPOSED SOLUTION.CONTINUED ON STATEMENT 27
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description2Txt: TRUST, MEDIA AND DEMOCRACY: THIS INITIATIVE EXPLORES THE ROLE OF TRUST IN JOURNALISM IN OUR DEMOCRACY TO EDUCATE A BROAD GROUP OF STAKEHOLDERS WITH RIGOROUS, NONPARTISAN, FACT-BASED RESEARCH. THE FOUNDATION SUPPORTED SIGNIFICANT NONPARTISAN OPINION RESEARCH AND SURVEYS CONDUCTED BY INDEPENDENT THIRD-PARTY FIRMS. THE RESEARCH AND SURVEYS EXPLORED PUBLIC ATTITUDES AS WELL AS WAYS TO BUILD COMMUNITY TRUST IN INFORMATION KNOWING THAT TRUST IN INFORMATION IS AN IMPORTANT FACTOR IN A HEALTHY COMMUNITY. THIS RESEARCH WAS PUBLICLY DISSEMINATED VIA SEVERAL MEDIUMS SO THAT IT COULD BE WIDELY AVAILABLE.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description3Txt: INFORMED CONFERENCE: AS PART OF KNIGHT'S SUPPORT FOR INFORMED AND ENGAGED COMMUNITIES, WE CONVENE MEMBERS OF THE KNIGHT RESEARCH NETWORK AND A RANGE OF EXPERTS FROM THE ACADEMY, GOVERNMENT, INDUSTRY, AND CIVIL SOCIETY TO DISCUSS AND DEBATE THE MOST SIGNIFICANT ISSUES AT THE CROSSROADS OF TECHNOLOGY, MEDIA AND DEMOCRACY. KNIGHT'S INFORMED CONFERENCE ELEVATES THE INSIGHTS FROM A GROWING FIELD OF SCHOLARSHIP THAT ADVANCE THE COMMON GOOD. ACCESS TO THE CONFERENCE WAS BROADLY AVAILABLE VIA LIVE STREAM.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description4Txt: KNIGHT MEDIA FORUM: THE KNIGHT MEDIA FORUM IS THE PREMIER GATHERING FOR FUNDERS AND MEDIA LEADERS WORKING TO STRENGTHEN LOCAL NEWS, COMMUNITY AND DEMOCRACY. THE CONVENING HAS EVOLVED OVER THE PAST SIXTEEN YEARS TO A 600-PERSON CONFERENCE IN PERSON AND WITH VIRTUAL PROGRAMMING TO INCLUDE EXPERTS AND LEADING PRACTITIONERS IN THESE AREAS. PARTICIPANTS LEAVE WITH I) AWARENESS OF CUTTING-EDGE ISSUES AND MAJOR TRENDS IN COMMUNITY NEWS AND INFORMATION, II) PRACTICAL TOOLS AND REPLICABLE IDEAS AND III) NEW PARTNERSHIPS AND RELATIONSHIPS TO HELP EXECUTE PROJECTS.

SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description1Txt: LYRASIS - TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN INTEGRATED PLATFORM TO PURCHASE AND LEND E-BOOKS TO PATRONS.

ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.FormAndInfoAndMaterialsTxt: APPLICATIONS FOR FUNDING ARE SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY VIA THE FOUNDATION WEBSITE. PLEASE GO TO WWW.KF.ORG TO APPLY FOR A GRANT. FOR JOURNALISM, COMMUNITIES, NATIONAL AND ARTS PROGRAMS, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION IN OUR ONLINE FORM: TELL US ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY PRESENTED BY YOUR IDEA/PROJECT, WHAT IT WILL TRANSFORM, AND THE IMPACT IT WILL HAVE. HOW WILL IT CREATE LASTING, VISIBLE CHANGE? TELL US HOW YOU INDENTIFIED THIS OPPORTUNITY AND WHY THE TIME IS RIGHT FOR IT. WHAT OTHER PARTNERS OR FUNDERS ARE INVOLVED IN THE IDEA/PROJECT? HOW WILL YOU MEASURE SUCCESS? HOW ARE YOU UNIQUELY QUALIFIED TO IMPLEMENT YOUR IDEA/PROJECT? PLEASE DESCRIBE ORGANIZATIONAL AND FINANCIAL CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT YOUR IDEA/PROJECT INCLUDING ANY BUSINESS PLAN. HOW WILL YOUR IDEA/PROJECT BE SUSTAINED BEYOND KNIGHT FOUNDATION'S FUNDING?
ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.SubmissionDeadlinesTxt: WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SPECIAL INITIATIVES AND CONTESTS, THE FOUNDATION DOES NOT HAVE DEADLINES.
ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.RestrictionsOnAwardsTxt: ANY RESTRICTIONS OR LIMITATIONS ON AWARDS, SUCH AS BY GEOGRAPHICAL AREAS, CHARITABLE FIELDS, KIND OF INSTITUTIONS OR OTHER FACTORS: -MEDICAL RESEARCH, ORGANIZATIONS OR PROJECTS WHOSE MISSION IS TO PREVENT, ERADICATE AND/OR ALLEVIATE THE EFFECTS OF A SPECIFIC DISEASE -POLITICAL CAMPAIGNS AND LEGISLATIVE LOBBYING EFFORTS -PROJECTS THAT EXCLUSIVELY SERVE RELIGIOUS PURPOSES -DIRECT SUPPORT FOR INDIVIDUALS

GeneralExplanationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990-PF, PART VII, LIST OF OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND TRUSTEES:
GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: THE FULL TIME WORKWEEK HAS BEEN ALLOCATED 40 HOURS. THOSE LISTED ARE EXEMPT POSITIONS WERE EMPLOYEES APPLY NECESSARY HOURS TO PERFORM THEIR JOB.THE TRUSTEES MEET FOUR TIMES A YEAR FOR BOARD AND COMMITTEE MEETINGS WHICH, INCLUDING TRAVEL, REQUIRE A MINIMUM OF TWO DAYS PER SESSION. TRUSTEES TYPICALLY DEVOTE A MINIMUM OF 8 FULL DAYS PER YEAR TO OVERSIGHT AND REVIEW OF THE FOUNDATION'S OPERATIONS PROGRAMS AND INVESTMENTS, THOUGH TYPICALLY MORE.
